content: I wish it could work on Mac

Fantastic app, works just as good if not better than a physical Stream Deck for just the price of a coffee. Both the desktop and mobile parts of the app are super easy to use and highly customisable. The only reason for 4 stars is there seems to be no option to disable having your phone display on permanently while the app is open. Phones or tablets with OLED screens will suffer burn-in after short use of this app unless you manually turn your screen off when not using it. The big problem with that is if you turn your screen off then the app goes to 'sleep' and when you turn the phone screen back on the app takes a while to reconnect to the desktop client. For the full 5 stars, I would like an option where the app fades to an all black screen after 30 seconds or a minute so that the screen is still technically on but will not damage an OLED screen and a simple tap of the screen will show your buttons again. The black screen would have to be set as a 'full screen' mode too in order to hide the notification bar which would also burn the screen if left there. Hope this can be added, I'll happily change to 5 stars if it does.
Honestly overall pretty good for what I use it for, I would recommend it for it's price, a lot cheaper than others, especially since it's a 1 time buy and not a subscription

This app is the very definition of value. No need to have a stream deck worth 300 dollars! This app will do pretty much anything you need for an effective stream experience.

I would give this 10 stars if I could. Not just for streamers but anyone who really cares about their workflow. Pair it with a mouse macro recorder, prepare to spend a few days adding new shortcuts, and watch your productivity skyrocket. This is a winner: - No subscription fees. - In active development. - Excellent UI. - Works beautifully on most Android devices, even old/budget ones. This app is only a couple of features away from making a Streamdeck an absolutely terrible investment.

it worked for a hour now it force closes every time I connect. My tablet is doing the samething. *Edit* I figured out the cause of the force closing. The app can only handle 7 gifs to tiles at a time. If you add more it'll cause it too crash on every connection. This is with low pic settings.
I use it for graphics editing. While I encountered minor issues (sometimes adding buttons needs to be done twice), it works flawlessly otherwise. Worth investing.

Long overdue edit of the review, sorry Riva. Besides a few minor points this app is absolutely great. Has rather active development (by 1 person). It's incredibly easy to set up but also pretty darn powerful. I am a streamer and this streamlines my actions during streams a lot. The best Android alternative so far to a ‚Ç¨150 Elgato Streamdeck. I do recommend getting a cheap tablet for for this though since you can just leave it on your desk in case you need your phone.
replyContent:
Did you make sure your device connected to the same network? Let me know if there's other error message?
EDIT: for OBS connection issue, please check https://github.com/rivafarabi/deckboard/issues/13 for additional bug, please report to https://github.com/rivafarabi/deckboard/issues or my email. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Was waiting for this
was great but can no longer connect since 1 use after purchasing. Update: turns out the firewall rules are not good enough. I add inbound private TCP for port 8500 and now it works. Adding a star.

Does not connect to Windows 10 PC at all. Not via the 2.4Ghz or 5Ghz channel. Keeps coming up with. 'Uh oh. This device cannot connect to your computer. Please try again." Have the latest Android and Windows 10 program. Followed all troubleshooting steps on github. Used different IP address under 'Possible IP addresses' option. Made sure both devices used same network. No firewall obstruction. No VPN in use. Turned off 4G. Does not work as intended. Do not buy.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. Sorry if the app doesn't meet your expectation. USB connection is in development right now for next release. I hope the future update will solve the issue.

Only downside I've found, is when you switch from pro layout to normal layout, the text wrap seems to stay the same, so what text looked fine on the free version normal grid, looks a touch off on the pro version normal grid. Just installed and already love it. Definitely worth the value for the proversion. I would have gladly paid more for the features that I have access to. I got it as an alternative to a stream deck and is better than I was hoping for. I already had hotkeys set up for my scenes so setup on the app was a breeze. I didn't use the obs web socket although I'm sure that would work great to. I just set up some macros popped in some thumbnails and boom. Makes switching scenes so much easier than trying to remember hot keys for 12 scenes. Thank you for the great app. Sorry for being long winded but this is the first app in a while that I liked enough to post a review :)
replyContent: Thanks for fantastic review :) Glad you enjoy the app

content: Solid app, 100% recommended and more than worth the price. The best alternative to a stream deck. I had some issues after an update, but the developer very quickly responded and fixed it, he also really listens to suggestions on the app's github and works very quickly on good ones. Thanks!
replyContent: Thanks for your support! Really appreciate the feedback.

content: Very nice app for those who don't want to pay premium for a streamdeck & have an extra tablet/phone lying around!   My only real complaint so far is that macros are very difficult to set. Sometimes they don't detect keys properly.  "[" shows up as "√õ" ... "]" shows up as "√ù" ... "\" shows up as "«ï" ... etc.  Clearing the keystroke field will show it blank, but then when you try to type out a new macro the old one suddenly shows back up with the new buttons at the end, & sometimes the sequence & combination seem to work in opposite of what they are set too.  Would be 5 stars if this gets fixed, as everything else works perfectly!

Love this app. Used to use something similar from others but this is so much better. Love the recent addition of Twitter support. Hope to get an option to assign a button to switch boards. Then it would be unlimited power!
replyContent: Glad you like the recent update. More improvements are on the way :)

content: Great UI on the app and windows software. Simple pairing process with phone and overall great performance. Great Job!  I still have one question though: Are there any plans in the future to let users execute Batch-scripts?
replyContent: Thanks for using Deckboard. Glad you like it. Any plan to add the function to execute .bat file? Yes :)

content:
This is almost exactly what I was looking for. If you could add more rows 
to fill the screen, and add to the macros and sync back to the computer it 
would be perfect. Preferably, adding rows before the ability to sync back. 
Having this for programs like fusion 360, Photoshop, obs and anything else 
is exactly what I need. Working with full screen interfaces and having the 
macros available on a second screen is like having one of those Maximus 
oled keyboards. Custom keys on my phone is a great choice over that.
